HomePage.concept:
It is better to learn cases than to learn theory 
It is better to learn from cases than to do them
It is better to play with cases than to make cases
Playing alone is worse than playing together
It is better to gather the best and most talented teachers from all over the world to play together

Hero.title: Educational Innovation in an Era of Change
Hero.subtitle: Explore new paradigms of education: practice-driven, project-oriented, elite aggregation, and collaborative win-win
Hero.tagline: Cultivating versatile talents with global vision and innovative spirit

title.name: Lu Lab
title.slogan: Building a “Stanford University” without walls online

items.address: 97 East Brokaw Road 310-F, San Jose, CA 95112, USA

mission.title: Mission
mission.content: Through project-based learning and innovative education, we cultivate versatile talents with global vision, innovative spirit, and practical abilities, helping young students achieve unconventional self-realization.

vision.title: Vision
vision.content: To create an online Stanford University with soul, promote educational reform, and cultivate innovative talents capable of meeting future challenges for modern society.

goal.title: Educational Goals
goal.content: We cultivate versatile talents with global vision, innovative spirit, and practical abilities. Through project-based learning and practice, students explore their interests and strengths in real-world problems, quickly identifying career directions. We emphasize practice-first, lifelong learning, and team collaboration, helping students achieve unconventional personal development and career breakthroughs while promoting educational equity and social progress.

Founder.title: Founder Introduction
Founder.name: Professor Lu Xiangqian
qualifications: Professor of Innovation and Entrepreneurship at Tsinghua SEM
Special Professor of Innovation/Entrepreneurship at MOE National Higher Education Teacher Network Training Center
Ph.D. from UC Berkeley Haas School of Business
MBA from Northwestern University Kellogg School of Management

experience.title: Rich Practical Experience
experience.content: Planned Motorola's entry strategy into China, taught at HKUST Business School, led investment funds, and is also a successful entrepreneur.

teaching.title: Teaching Achievements
teaching.content: Lu Lab's students have founded multiple unicorn companies. Professor Lu encourages students to join emerging startups for further development, aiming for financial freedom before 30. He personally recommends opportunities to outstanding students, connecting them with founder and CEO guests of the lab.

philosophy.title: Living Educational Philosophy
philosophy.content: Professor Lu's two children joined Lu Lab since high school. His daughter graduated from Stanford University and was an early employee at Pinterest and Airtable; his son studies at UC Berkeley, joined Uber full-time at 19, and is now an early employee at Flexport while maintaining his studies.

items.title: Practice First
items.content: Emphasizing 'learning from cases is better than theory, doing cases is better than learning them, playing with cases is better than doing them,' transforming knowledge into ability through practical activities

items.title: Project-Based Learning
items.content: Adopting real problem-oriented learning models to cultivate innovation ability through solving practical problems

items.title: Early Trial and Error
items.content: Encouraging exploration and experimentation at low-cost stages, learning from failures to find one's interests and strengths

items.title: Collaborative Win-Win
items.content: Promoting the concept of 'gathering talents and masters worldwide to learn together,' fostering mutual learning and progress through teamwork

items.title: Personalized Development
items.content: Respecting student uniqueness, providing tailored development plans, supporting unconventional growth paths

items.title: Lifelong Learning
items.content: Inspiring sustained learning enthusiasm, focusing on interest cultivation and capability building, promoting educational innovation

items.title: Global Vision
items.content: Introducing top global educational resources, cultivating innovative talents with international perspective

items.title: School-Family Collaboration
items.content: Emphasizing parental involvement in education, encouraging parents to learn and grow with their children

items.title: Future-Oriented
items.content: Dedicated to cultivating innovative talents capable of meeting future challenges, promoting educational reform

Origin.title: Origins
content: Lu Lab originated from Professor Lu's deep reflection on his two children's education. While teaching mathematical finance at HKUST, he witnessed the rise of the internet wave, foresaw the opportunities brought by technological revolution, and subsequently started entrepreneurship achieving financial freedom.

His Silicon Valley experience revealed that even top university graduates face employment challenges, while those who engaged with computers early and excelled in computer communication were highly sought after. This led him to spend five years researching educational methods, successfully applying them to his own children.

With a heart to give back to Tsinghua University, Professor Lu hopes to help more students overcome basic computer skills and English learning difficulties. He innovatively designed a family-friendly learning model, delivering quality educational content directly to learners through the internet, enabling effective parental participation and companionship.

Drawing from Stanford University's educational philosophy, the lab is committed to popularizing advanced educational methods through online platforms, realizing the vision of making elite education accessible to ordinary families. Facing the mismatch between traditional education and modern society's needs, the lab cultivates future talents adapted to new economic development through innovative educational models.

milestones.content: Professor Lu foresightedly predicted the internet would revolutionize the world and began focusing on innovative education models.
Established innovation and entrepreneurship courses at Tsinghua SEM, aiming to cultivate students' practical abilities and innovative thinking.
Extended courses from Tsinghua classrooms to online platforms to reach a broader audience, initiating the lab's internet education exploration.
Collaborated with Fudan University in teaching, promoting cross-university cooperation in innovation and entrepreneurship education.

The lab has gradually formed a systematic project-based learning model, collaborating with top global entrepreneurs and business leaders, cultivating numerous versatile talents with global vision and innovative practical abilities, realizing the vision of an online Stanford University.
